reviewText: Lewis Black is a Jewish comedian with a pension for yelling and getting frustrated with the political world that we live in. In Red, White & Screwed Lewis offers his observations and thoughts on a whole manner of topics but you can bet everyone of them is as funny as hell! I recommend him to anyone that loves comedy and political satire!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I first saw this show on a plane on my way to New York City, I've always been familiar with Lewis Black and his kind of work, but have never seen a complete show. One thing I have to say about Black is the irreverence of his comedy is truly superb. Whereas some comedians find themselves beating around the proberbial Bush when dealing with political issues and opinions. There are other comedians who do poke at politicians and political issues in an objective way but none like Lewis Black. He's foul mouthed, he's Jewish and possibly the most intelligent American comedian since Bill Hicks.Bill himself describes his style of humour as ""being on the Titanic every single day and being the only person who knows what is going to happen." This is so true of the man as when he's delivering his comedy, you feel that he's going to fall apart. He's also said in the past that rather then write down his jokes, he simply talks about a subject that makes him angry and only changes the subject when he comes close to having a stroke.He has a look on the world that we all do, yet he puts an extreme comic twist on the whole thing. We've all read the paper and seen the news and thought to ourselves "what the hell are they doing?" Lewis Black is at the forefront of this and makes us all curl up in stitches of laughter as he explains to us the Dick Cheney incident in his own trademark way. Although it's unlikely, Black gives me the impression that he's improvising the entire routine from something he read in the paper that day. It could be possible, but I'd hate to say that it's highly doubtful.Looking at how long Black has been on the comedy scene, I'm genuinely surprised that he isn't a bigger personality on an international scale. One thing's for sure and that he's a man who never fails to make me laugh, and he simply makes you want to watch the news to see what he's seeing.

reviewText: One of the things that I like about Lewis Black is his ability,indeed his enthusiastic willingness to attack  anyone whose conduct,or agenda indicates a need for his special talents..And what are his special talents,you may ask?Taking morons,liars,idiots,presidents,wannabe-presidents,unnecessary wars,trigger-happy vice presidents,and all of the rest to task...Black takes no prisoners..Sure,Bush,Cheyney,and the rest of the right wing gang of idiots get thiers,but so does John Kerry,so in this Lewis Black is an equal opportunity slasher..Some may complain of Black's liberal use of that other word for fornication,but my view is that when dealing with such topics as our unending debacle in Iraq the"F" word just isn't strong enough,and one has to admire Black for not using it even more often here than he has..Is black funny?Does a bear defecate in the woods?Is the pope a catholic?YES HE'S FUNNY !
Title: N/A

reviewText: Lewis Blacks Red,White & Screwed is a scream.From opening to ending this dvd is hillarious.I laughed so hard i had tears comming out of my eyes.His topical humor is right on point.His bit about Dick Cheyne is hysterical as is everything else in this stand out,stand up performance.To me Lewis Black is one of the funniest comedians these days and this is even a cut above the rest. If you are new to Lewis Blacks humor then i strongly recommend this dvd,you will be happily delighted.

reviewText: We were not disappointed in "Red, White and Screwed".  We have watched it several times and still crack up laughing.  There are of course many people who are probably put off by the language in Mr. Black's shows, but he is a master of irony, and we thoroughly enjoy his views presented in this new DVD.

reviewText: Lewis Black is the rage in all of us, unbelievably tempered.  When you watch him you won't think that he is tempered at all, but I think about what he jokes about and think 'if I was talking about it I would say...' and it's always worse.  You know there is a great value in being in the presence of someone who is more than willing to say what you would like to say if only you had the nerve to say it.  Watching Lewis Black is not only a good laugh, it is a personal relief of emotion.
Title: N/A

reviewText: We were crying with laughter and screaming at the TV.  Not only do I recommend that you buy this DVD, I'm going to buy copies for my friends.I haven't seen his other DVDs, so I can't comment on whether those are better.  You'll have to rely on the other reviewers for that.  But during my years living in Washington DC, I saw my share of comics at the Warner Theater and I can assure you, Lewis Black KILLS!!Razor sharp, topical humor delivered with the kind of righteous anger that makes you leap off the couch and yell "YES!!"  His comments on current events in America are spot-on and neither side of the political aisle escapes his withering assessment.So gather some friends, open the libation of your choice, turn on the DVD and let the crying and screaming begin!

reviewText: Lewis Black never ceases to make me laugh.  Red, White, and Screwed finds the in your face, politically charged comedian in Washington; and where would be a better place for the comic to perform I ask of you?  Black reveals his troubles with scheduling his performance at the Kennedy Center (just picture someone sitting there, counting how many times he said the F word), while offering scathing commentary on Dick Cheney's hunting "mishap", the Iraq war, homophobia, and offers his thoughts on horse shows as well.  He also goes into great length in describing his upbringing in Silverspring, Maryland and why he tells people he's from D.C., as well as getting the call to perform for the President himself (which concluded in a hysterical result).  Black may be more coarse than he needs to be to get his point across, but he remains one of the best stand up comedians out there today, and this HBO special only offers up more proof of that.  There's a few extras included on the DVD, but nearly enough as one would like.
summary: Absolutely hilarious stand up special from Lewis Black
Title: N/A

reviewText: If you're of an opinion that ranges from the far left/right or are easily offended by religious/political humor, then you're likely to miss out on some of the best bipartisan commentary out there. Black's writing certainly overshadows his delivery, so if you can get past his raspy voice and rolling eyes, then you're bound to be entertained by what he has to say -- and maybe even agree! In either case, it's refreshing to hear somebody speaking their mind that actually makes sense. (7/10)
summary: Some of the Best Bipartisan Commentary Out There
